meanings.definition: To concentrate or focus on a particular point or area.
meanings.sent1: She tried to focalize on her homework, but her mind kept wandering.
meanings.sent2: He needed to focalize on the task at hand to complete it on time.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to focalize on catching the elusive red dot.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to win the race helped her focalize on the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The coach's pep talk helped the team focalize on their goal of winning the championship.

meanings.definition: To adjust the focus of a lens or optical device.
meanings.sent1: He carefully focalized the camera to capture the perfect shot.
meanings.sent2: The photographer needed to focalize the lens to get a clear picture.
meanings.sent3: The detective tried to focalize the binoculars to get a better view of the suspect.
meanings.sent4: She quickly focalized the telescope to see the distant stars clearly.
meanings.sent5: The scientist had to focalize the microscope to examine the tiny cells.

meanings.definition: To bring into focus or clarity.
meanings.sent1: The new glasses helped her focalize the words on the page.
meanings.sent2: He needed to focalize his thoughts to make an important decision.
meanings.sent3: The fog slowly lifted to help focalize the outline of the mountain.
meanings.sent4: The meditation session helped her focalize her emotions and find inner peace.
meanings.sent5: The artist used bold colors to focalize the main subject of the painting.
